Escape by Night (1937) is an American crime drama directed by Hamilton MacFadden and distributed by Republic Pictures. This restored and colorized edition brings new life to a little-known public domain film that combines gritty urban crime storytelling with themes of loyalty, identity, and moral struggle. The film follows a small-time reporter, William ‚ÄúBill‚Äù Keller (William Hall), who becomes entangled with the underworld while investigating a notorious gangster. Keller poses as a fellow criminal to infiltrate the mob and gain insider access to their operations. During his time undercover, he encounters the sharp and determined Anne (Anne Nagel), a woman with ties to the criminal world who begins to question her own loyalties.

As Bill gets deeper into his dangerous masquerade, he must maintain his false identity while gathering enough evidence to bring the gang down. Suspense heightens when his cover is nearly blown, forcing him into a perilous balancing act between survival and his duty as a reporter. With trust scarce and betrayal constant, Escape by Night builds toward a dramatic confrontation where Bill must risk everything to expose corruption and save both himself and Anne from destruction.
